text: Stick to finishing goals in a timely manner
author: Brie

text: Your level of success will seldom exceed your level of PERSONAL DEVELOPMENT
author: Jim Rohn

text: True satisfaction lies not in clutching at fleeting rewards but in appreciating what’s already within our grasp
author: Ryan Holiday

text: This is the real secret to life—to be completely engaged with what you are doing in the here and now. And instead of calling it work, realize it is play.
author: Alan Watts

text: If there's a problem, there's a solution to it.
author: MIK

text: We are more fulfilled when we are involved in something bigger than ourselves
author: John Glenn

text: Two simple rules: 1. You get better at what you practice. 2. Everything is pracice. What are you practicing?
author: James Clear

text: A year from now, you may wish you had started today
author: Karen Lamb

text: Anywhere, you can lead your life. You can lead a good one
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: The best way to handle pressure is to apply it
author: James Clear

text: Once in a while it hits people that they don't have to experience the world in the way they have been told.
author: Alan Keightley

text: Practice the art of interpreting situations constructively.
author: Unknown

text: Cherish your visions and your dreams as they are the children of your soul, the blueprints of your ultimate achievements.
author: Napolian Hill

text: Pain is inevitable, but suffering depends on us (it's Optional).
author: Dr. Claude

text: Don’t give into temptations. Make time for them according to your will and plan. Realise the long term effects. Eg: spending time at the cost of summer and winter internship(s), when you left rented cycle for play
author: Self

text: Every day is a good day
author: John, The Bus Driver

text:
Self-talk strategies:
If you need confidence, talk to yourself the way you would talk to a friend.
If you need persistence, talk to yourself the way you would talk to a student.
If you need patience, talk to yourself the way you would talk to a child.
author: James Clear

text: Pursue the things you love doing and then do them so well that people can’t take their eyes off of you.
author: Maya Angelou

text: Learn from the mistakes of others. You can never live long enough to make them all yourself
author: Groucho Marx

text: For months, you and I have been debating 'Are people good or bad?' But as I watched those 3 people pick themselves up and dust themselves off. I realized we've been asking the wrong question. What matters isn't if people are good or bad*. What matters is if they're trying to be better today than they were yesterday. You ask me where my hope comes from? That's your answer. * IMO it does
author: Michael

text: “If you cannot do great things, do small things in a great way.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: “Dude, suckin' at something is the first step to being sorta good at something.”
author: Jake

text: Problems are what gives our lives meaning, solving them.
author: Self

text: I, and I alone, am responsible for everything I think and feel.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: Sometimes the people we save, they save us right back
author: Deadpool

text: Nothing diminishes anxiety faster than action.
author: Walter Anderson

text: I will keep constant watch over myself and—most usefully—will put each day up for review. For this is what makes us evil — that none of us looks back upon our own lives. We reflect upon only that which we are about to do. And yet our plans for the future descend from the past.
author: Seneca

text: A long to-do list seems intimidating and burdensome—all these things we have to do in the course of a day or a week. But a get-to-do list sounds like a privilege—all the things we’re excited about the opportunity to experience. This isn’t just semantic play. It is a central facet of the philosopher’s worldview.
author: Ryan Holiday

text: He that shall endure unto the end, the same shall be saved
author: Matthew 24:13

text: We never step in the same river twice. We should take these thoughts, write them, read them aloud, talk to yourself and others about them
author: self thought

text: I'm not saying that you have to be a reader to save your soul in the modern world. I'm saying it helps.
author: Walter Mosely

text: Practice, which some regard as a chore, should be approached as just about the most pleasant recreation ever devised
author: Babe Didrikson Zaharias

text: Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less.”
author: Marie Curie

text: The magic lies in the work you're avoiding
author: Unknown

text: It is our duty to try to improve ourselves
author: Chidi

text: Someone is getting through something hard right now because you've got their back
author: Unknown

text: Each time you overcome your cravings, you become stronger for the next time.
author: Hazem

text: I'm not behind because I'm not in a race, my worth does not need to be earned, it is inherent.
author: Stephanie Harrison

text: Even though we've got a fight ahead of us, we've got one thing Voldemort doesn't have. Something worth fighting for.
author: Harry Potter

text: Things we lose have a way of coming back to us in the end. If not always in the way we expect.
author: Luna Lovegood

text: Well, it may have escaped your notice, but life isn't fair.
author: Severous Snape

text: The world isn't split into good people and death eaters. We've all got both light and dark inside of us. What matters is the part we choose to act on. That's who we really are.
author: Serious Black

text: Working hard is important, but there's something that matters even more: Believing in youself. Every great wizard in history has started out as nothing more than what we are now: Students. If they can do it, why not us
author: Harry Potter

text: To give, and not to count the cost. To fight, and not to heed the wounds. To toil, and not to seek for rest. To labor, and not to ask for any reward
author: St. Ignatius of Loyola

text: Which activities are the best expression of you? Can you spend five minutes doing one of them today?
author: James Clear

text: As developers, we're privileged to have the ability to create solutions for our own challenges.
author: Kamran Ahmed

text: The first principle is that you must not fool yourself and you are the easiest person to fool.
author: Richard P. Feynman

text: Happiness can be found even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light.
author: Albus Dumbledore
source: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban

text: Faith means you have peace even when you don't have all the answers.
author: Anonymous

text: Patience is not about how long you can wait but how well you behave while you're waiting.
author: Anonymous

text: If my mind can conceive it and my heart can believe it, then I can achieve it.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: I bled that night, and I don't bleed.
author: Steve Jobs

text: It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.
author: Albus Dumbledore
source: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

text: All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us.
author: Gandalf
source: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring

text: Your problem is you've spent your whole life thinking there are rules. There aren't.
author: Lorne Malvo
